item.title: RephQA: Evaluating Readability of Large Language Models in Public Health Question Answering
item.description: arXiv:2509.16360v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) hold promise in addressing complex medical problems. However, while most prior studies focus on improving accuracy and reasoning abilities, a significant bottleneck in developing effective healthcare agents lies in the rea...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, reasoning, model, large language model, prompt | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: SubDyve: Subgraph-Driven Dynamic Propagation for Virtual Screening Enhancement Controlling False Positive
item.description: arXiv:2509.16273v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Virtual screening (VS) aims to identify bioactive compounds from vast chemical libraries, but remains difficult in low-label regimes where only a few actives are known. Existing methods largely rely on general-purpose molecular fingerprints and overlo...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> zero-shot, framework, arxiv, embedding | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy.
